biography.content: Yu Liu is a Professor and Chair of Department of Industrial Engineering in the School of Mechanical, Electronic, and Industrial Engineering, at the University of Electronic Science and Technology of China. He received his Ph.D. degree in Mechatronics Engineering from the University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, Sichuan, China, in 2010. He was a Visiting Predoctoral Fellow in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at Northwestern University, Evanston, IL, USA, from 2008 to 2010, and a Postdoctoral Research Fellow in the Department of Mechanical Engineering, at the University of Alberta, Edmonton, Canada from 2012 to 2013. His research interests include system reliability modeling and analysis, maintenance decisions, prognostics and health management, and design under uncertainty. He has published more than 50 peer-reviewed papers in international journals and conferences. He also serves as the reviewer of IEEE Transactions on Reliability, Journal of Mechanical Design-Transactions of the ASME, Journal of Risk and Reliability, the Program Committee Co-Chairs of QR2MSE International Conference. , and the Program Committee Member of 2012 Prognostics and System Health Management Conference. He was a recipient of the HIWIN Doctoral Dissertation Award sponsored by HIWIN Technologies Corporation and Chinese Society of Mechanical Engineers.

keyword.content: Reliability, Maintenance Decision, Prognostics and Health Management, Design under Uncertainty
